content.text: The hormone insulin is a relatively small protein. Researchers studying the production of insulin in the cells of the pancreas noted that one of the early steps in this process was the formation of a polypeptide called preproinsulin.\n\nResearchers noted that the formation of this polypeptide required repeated use of different types of Molecule X, shown below.

questions.prompt: What is the name of Molecule X?
How does Molecule X play a role in the production of preproinsulin?

The coding information in the DNA molecule for preproinsulin is initially transferred to another molecule (Molecule W). However, Molecule W has a different nucleotide sequence from the coding section of the DNA molecule.\n\nDescribe how Molecule W is synthesised.
